results.title: Animal olympians
results.brief_description: Fascinating comparisons are made between human Olympic skills and feats in the animal world. Shows many animal performances such as breath-held depth diving, animal marksmen, gliding, speed flying, soaring and hovering.
results.description: Fascinating comparisons are made between human Olympic skills and feats in the animal world. Shows many animal performances such as breath-held depth diving, animal marksmen, gliding, speed flying, soaring and hovering.

results.title: Animal migration
results.brief_description: Describes the migratory patterns of animals such as the mountain sheep, monarch butterfly, whale, elephant seal, salmon and arctic tern. Examines the reasons for animals migrating, the ways in which they navigate, and the scientific methods used to study migration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animal life in the hedgerows
results.brief_description: A study of the English animals, birds, insects and other wild creatures to be found in the hedgerows and fiels, Photographed by Oliver Pike. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animal life at low tide
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: A boy and girl visit the seashore and, at a tide-pool find and study many salt-water animals and their means of locomotion, protection and getting food. Included are starfish, tube-building sea worms, sea anemone, limpet, sea urchin, snails and the moulting of hermit crabs. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animal life
results.brief_description: A review of the main types of animal - protozoans, sponges, colelenterates, echinoderms, worms, molluscs, crustaceans, insects, and vertebrates. There is also a description of animal functions - locomotion, food intake, digestion, waste disposal, respiration, and nervous system activity.

results.title: Animal husbandry
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and John C. Elder
results.brief_description: A detailed study of livestock farming in Scotland; locations are indicated by maps; statistical charts are shown; marketing is shown at a tyupical local market; daily work on various farms is shown, including farms specialising in sheep, beef cattle, dairy cattle and pigs.
results.description: A detailed study of livestock farming in Scotland; locations are indicated by maps; statistical charts are shown; marketing is shown at a tyupical local market; daily work on various farms is shown, including farms specialising in sheep, beef cattle, dairy cattle and pigs.

results.title: Animal homes. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: A number of different animals, insects such as ants and a spider, various birds, a beady eyed and rather charming mouse, and other larger mammals are shown making and living in their homes. The principal uses to which animals put their homes, safety, shelter, food storage and the raising of young, are reiterated as they are found in various species. The human parallel is drawn by a group of children who run into the house when a storm occurs. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Animal health field stations
results.brief_description: Research at the CSIRO Animal Research Laboratory at Parkville, Melbourne, is aimed at maintaining the health of sheep, cattle, pigs and poultry improving their productive performance. To succeed with this program the Laboratory has field stations at Maribyrnong, Werribee and Seymour, where animals can be reared free of specified diseases.

results.title: Animal friends
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Roll-call in the Rockies: In Banff National Park census takers on horseback count animals. Zoo Comes to Class: Animals from Stanley Park Zoo visit an elementary school in Vancouver. It’s A Dog’s Life: The S.P.C.A. in Montreal performs good deeds for people’s pets.
